sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide that total taxation by the Federal Government of the people of the United States shall not exceed 15 per centum of the gross national product, and to provide that appropriations made by the United States shall not exceed its revenues, except in time of war or national emergency.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

policyArea.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States guaranteeing the right of life to the unborn.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to give citizens of the United States the right to enact and repeal laws by voting on legislation in a national election.

latestAction.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A resolution to amend the Rules of the House of Representatives to establish the Committee on Internal Security, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A resolution to amend the Rules of the House of Representatives to require that reports accompanying certain bills and joint resolutions reported by committees contain computations of the potential tax impact of such bills and resolutions on the individual taxpayer.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Consumer Affairs and Coinage.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A resolution to reaffirm the use of our national motto on currency.

latestAction.text: Referred to Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.

sponsoredLegislation.title: A concurrent resolution urging the President to attempt to bring about the establishment of an international food cartel involving the major food exporting countries which would use export prices for food commodities as a bargaining tool in negotiations with the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries for reasonable oil prices.
